contents: <sup>8</sup>Comedian Jon Stewart, who was born in New Jersey and had a television show based in New York, called Chicago-style pizza “tomato soup in a bread bowl,” among other not-so-flattering names. <sup>9</sup>Chicagoans, proud of their version of the dish, like to disparage New York pizza as “deflated pizza” or “limp pizza” because it lacks the bulk and substance of the deep dish variety. <sup>10</sup>Which kind is best? <sup>11</sup>Stewart thinks the answer can be found in the name. <sup>12</sup>In Chicago, he says, people have to use extra words, referring to it as “deep-dish” pizza, or “Chicago-style” pizza. <sup>13</sup>“In New York, you know what we call it?” asks Stewart. <sup>14</sup>“Pizza.”
